TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit CollectionConverter extends System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter

Docs.summary: Provides a type converter to convert collection objects to and from various other representations.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.ComponentModel.CollectionConverter.GetProperties%2A> method for this type converter always returns `null`, and the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.GetPropertiesSupported%2A> method always returns `false`.
For more information about type converters, see the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class and [How to: Implement a Type Converter](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
> [!NOTE] > You should never create an instance of the CollectionConverter class. Instead, call the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetConverter%2A> method of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> class. For more information, see the examples in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public override object ConvertTo (System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, System.Globalization.CultureInfo culture, object value, Type destinationType);

.method public hidebysig virtual instance object ConvertTo(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, class System.Globalization.CultureInfo culture, object value, class System.Type destinationType) cil managed

Docs.param: An that provides a format context.
The culture to which `value` will be converted.
The <xref:System.Object> to convert. This parameter must inherit from <xref:System.Collections.ICollection>.
The <xref:System.Type> to convert the value to.
Docs.summary: Converts the given value object to the specified destination type.
Docs.returns: An <xref:System.Object> that represents the converted value.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `context` parameter can be used to extract additional information about the environment this converter is being invoked from. This can be `null`, so always check. Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.
> [!NOTE] > The converted result will be shown in the property browser. For example, if you are converting a char collection into a string, it will be displayed as `char[] collection`.

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptorCollection GetProperties (System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, object value, Attribute[] attributes);

.method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptorCollection GetProperties(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, object value, class System.Attribute[] attributes) cil managed

Docs.param: An that provides a format context.
An <xref:System.Object> that specifies the type of array to get the properties for.
An array of type <xref:System.Attribute> that will be used as a filter.
Docs.summary: Gets a collection of properties for the type of array specified by the value parameter using the specified context and attributes.
Docs.returns: A with the properties that are exposed for this data type, or if there are no properties. This method always returns .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `context` parameter can be used to extract additional information about the environment this converter is being invoked from. This can be `null`, so always check. Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.
The attributes array that you pass in will be used to filter the array. The attributes can have a mix of <xref:System.Type> and <xref:System.Attribute> objects. Filtering is defined by the following rules:
- A <xref:System.Type> object will be treated as a wildcard; it will match any property that has the <xref:System.Type> in its set of attributes.
- If a property does not have an <xref:System.Attribute> of the same class, the property will not be included in the returned array.
- If the attribute is an instance of <xref:System.Attribute>, the property must be an exact match or it will not be included in the returned array.
- If an <xref:System.Attribute> instance is specified and it is the default property, it will be included in the returned array even if there is no instance of the <xref:System.Attribute> in the property.
Collections do not support properties; therefore, this method always returns `null`.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool GetPropertiesSupported(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context) cil managed

Docs.param: An that provides a format context.
Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this object supports properties.
Docs.returns: because <xref:System.ComponentModel.CollectionConverter.GetProperties%2A> should not be called to find the properties of this object. This method never returns .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `context` parameter can be used to extract additional information about the environment this converter is being invoked from. This can be `null`, so always check. Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.
Collections do not support properties; therefore, this method always returns `false`.
